enrichments.activityName: Documentation of Non-Childbearing Status or Pregnancy Test

processingRequirements.timeConstraint: Allow to clot for 30 minutes at room temperature.

_specimenEnrichment.activityName: Documentation of Non-Childbearing Status or Pregnancy Test
_specimenEnrichment.rationale: Footnote 'h' specifies a serum pregnancy test at Screening and urine tests at subsequent visits. Section 8.3.1 confirms that serum pregnancy tests are sent to the central laboratory. Tube type (SST) and volume are inferred based on standard requirements for serum tests. Processing and storage are inferred based on standard procedures for serum samples for safety testing.

This activity combines two standard safety panels. Hematology requires whole blood (typically a 4 mL K2 EDTA lavender top tube) and Chemistry requires serum (typically a 5 mL SST gold top tube). Section 8.3.1 confirms these tests are sent to the central laboratory. The protocol defers to the laboratory manual for specific collection, processing, and shipping instructions, so these details are inferred based on standard clinical practice.

This is a standard urine safety test. Section 8.3.1 confirms that urinalysis samples are sent to the central laboratory. The protocol defers to the laboratory manual for specific collection instructions; a standard 10 mL spot urine collection in a sterile cup is inferred.

processingRequirements.timeConstraint: processed to plasma within 30 minutes of collection

_specimenEnrichment.rationale: Section 8.3.2 provides explicit and complete instructions for the collection, processing, and storage of PD plasma markers. All details are extracted directly from the protocol text.
Section 8.3.2 provides explicit and complete instructions for the collection, processing, and storage of serum markers. All details are extracted directly from the protocol text.

Section 8.3.3 provides explicit requirements for the tumor tissue sample. It specifies the format (FFPE block or 15-20 unstained slides) and the condition that a fresh biopsy is required if archival tissue is unavailable.

processingRequirements.timeConstraint: placed on ice immediately after collection
frozen at -70 °C or lower within 60 minutes of collection

_specimenEnrichment.rationale: Section 8.3.4 provides explicit and complete instructions for the collection, processing, and storage of Veliparib PK samples. The protocol specifies tube type, volume, and strict time and temperature constraints for handling.

ACT-007.activityName: Documentation of Non-Childbearing Status or Pregnancy Test

volumes.visitContext: Screening (Serum). Urine test at subsequent visits.

processing.timeConstraint: Allow to clot for 30 minutes at room temperature.

ACT-007.conditionText: Serum pregnancy test at Screening. Urine pregnancy test at C1D-2 and subsequent Cycle 1 Days. Applies to Women of Childbearing Potential (WOCBP) only.
ACT-007.rationale: Footnote 'h' specifies a serum pregnancy test at Screening and urine tests at subsequent visits. Section 8.3.1 confirms that serum pregnancy tests are sent to the central laboratory. Tube type (SST) and volume are inferred based on standard requirements for serum tests. Processing and storage are inferred based on standard procedures for serum samples for safety testing.
textSnippets: h. Serum pregnancy test will be done at Screening. Urine pregnancy test will be done prior to dosing at C1D-2 unless the serum pregnancy test was collected within 7 days of C1D-2.
Serum pregnancy tests will be performed at Screening for all WOCBP.

All clinical laboratory tests (hematology, serum chemistry, urinalysis, and serum pregnancy) must be sent to the central laboratory (see the Laboratory Manual for specific collection and shipping instructions).

ACT-008.rationale: This activity combines two standard safety panels. Hematology requires whole blood (typically a 4 mL K2 EDTA lavender top tube) and Chemistry requires serum (typically a 5 mL SST gold top tube). Section 8.3.1 confirms these tests are sent to the central laboratory. The protocol defers to the laboratory manual for specific collection, processing, and shipping instructions, so these details are inferred based on standard clinical practice.
textSnippets: The following hematology parameters will be measured: hemoglobin, hematocrit, platelets, and white blood cell (WBC) count with differential.
The following serum chemistry parameters will be measured: ...

All clinical laboratory tests (hematology, serum chemistry, urinalysis, and serum pregnancy) must be sent to the central laboratory (see the Laboratory Manual for specific collection and shipping instructions).

ACT-009.rationale: This is a standard urine safety test. Section 8.3.1 confirms that urinalysis samples are sent to the central laboratory. The protocol defers to the laboratory manual for specific collection instructions; a standard 10 mL spot urine collection in a sterile cup is inferred.
textSnippets: Urinalysis will include the following: color, appearance, specific gravity, pH, protein, glucose, ketones, bilirubin, blood, nitrite, and leukocytes. A microscopic examination will be performed if indicated.

All clinical laboratory tests (hematology, serum chemistry, urinalysis, and serum pregnancy) must be sent to the central laboratory (see the Laboratory Manual for specific collection and shipping instructions).

processing.timeConstraint: processed to plasma within 30 minutes of collection

ACT-022.rationale: Section 8.3.2 provides explicit and complete instructions for the collection, processing, and storage of PD plasma markers. All details are extracted directly from the protocol text.
textSnippets: Blood for plasma markers will be collected in one 6 mL K2EDTA tube.
The sample should be processed to plasma within 30 minutes of collection.
The plasma should be stored at -70 °C or lower until shipped to the central laboratory for analysis.

ACT-023.rationale: Section 8.3.2 provides explicit and complete instructions for the collection, processing, and storage of serum markers. All details are extracted directly from the protocol text.
textSnippets: Blood for serum markers will be collected in one 6 mL serum separator tube (SST).
The sample should be allowed to clot for 30 minutes and then processed to serum.
The serum should be stored at -70 °C or lower until shipped to the central laboratory for analysis.

ACT-024.conditionText: An archival FFPE tumor tissue sample is required. If an archival sample is not available, a fresh biopsy must be obtained prior to randomization.
ACT-024.rationale: Section 8.3.3 provides explicit requirements for the tumor tissue sample. It specifies the format (FFPE block or 15-20 unstained slides) and the condition that a fresh biopsy is required if archival tissue is unavailable.
textSnippets: A tumor tissue sample (formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded [FFPE] block or 15-20 unstained slides) from the most recent biopsy is required for central laboratory biomarker analysis.
If an archival sample is not available, a fresh biopsy must be obtained prior to randomization.

processing.timeConstraint: placed on ice immediately after collection
frozen at -70 °C or lower within 60 minutes of collection

ACT-025.rationale: Section 8.3.4 provides explicit and complete instructions for the collection, processing, and storage of Veliparib PK samples. The protocol specifies tube type, volume, and strict time and temperature constraints for handling.
textSnippets: Blood (approximately 3 mL) will be collected into a K2EDTA tube at each time point.
Samples should be placed on ice immediately after collection and centrifuged within 30 minutes at 4 °C.
The resulting plasma should be transferred to a cryovial and frozen at -70 °C or lower within 60 minutes of collection.

_agentDefinition.purpose: Extracts detailed specimen collection requirements (tube types, volumes, processing instructions) from protocol text and lab manuals, enabling precise site logistics.
_agentDefinition.extractionMethodology: PDF search for specimen/collection tables using Gemini File API. Pattern matching for tube colors, volumes (mL), temperature requirements. Cross-reference with laboratory specifications extraction module.

keyOutputs.description: Type of specimen (blood, urine, tissue, etc.)

downstreamIntegrations.automationExample: IRT kit builder auto-selects tubes: 2x EDTA (4mL), 1x SST (6mL) per visit
Lab form includes collection checklist with tube types and expected volumes
Lab requisition auto-filled with specimen handling instructions
Supply system calculates tube requirements: visits x sites x buffer = order quantity

automationInsights.description: Specimen details drive exact kit contents for each visit type
Processing instructions feed into site training materials
Volume requirements enable automated deviation flagging

dataQualityIndicators: tube type is from standard list
